commit.message: NMS-12729: Add openconfig support for Telemetryd

NMS-12729: Move certain listener functionality to parser

Address review commetns
NMS=12729: Move all stream handling to parser, more cleanup, add IT
Add support for defining "connectors" in the telemetryd configuration.
Move the FilterService to the DAO API.
NMS-12729: Move to Connector, Refactor scheduling part

nodes.bodyText: Wouldn't we expect opennms-telemetry-openconfig to also load opennms-telemetry-openconfig-client?
We should probably remove one of these.

@@ -24,6 +24,34 @@
         </adapter>
     </queue>
 
+    <!-- OpenConfig -->
+    <connector name="OpenConfig-Connector"
+               class-name="org.opennms.netmgt.telemetry.protocols.openconfig.connector.OpenConfigConnector"
+               service-name="OpenConfig"
+               queue="OpenConfig"
+               enabled="true">
+        <package name="OpenConfig-Default">

commit.message: NMS-12729: More changes, Add end-to-end IT

nodes.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            _Listeners_ and attached _Parsers_ or _Connectors_ on one side, receive telemetry data transported over a specific protocol and parse the protocol according to its specification.
          
          
            
            _Listeners_ and attached _Parsers_ or _Connectors_ on one side receive telemetry data transported over a specific protocol and parse the data according to the protocol's specification.
          
      
    
    
  

I believe it is the data that is parsed, not the protocol, hence my suggested edit.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -10,7 +10,7 @@ With _telemetryd_, operators can define listeners supporting different protocols
 image::telemetryd/telemetryd-overview.png[]
 
 The configuration is split in two parts.
-_Listeners_ and attached _Parsers_ on one side, receive telemetry data transported over a specific protocol and parse the protocol according to its specification.
+_Listeners_ and attached _Parsers_ or _Connectors_ on one side, receive telemetry data transported over a specific protocol and parse the protocol according to its specification.

nodes.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            _Connectors_ initiate a connection and maintain a session with agent. A new connector is created for every agent it is responsible for connecting to.
          
          
            
            _Connectors_ initiate a connection and maintain a session with an agent. A new connector is created for every agent it is responsible for connecting to.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -28,6 +28,15 @@ _Parsers_ and _Listeners_ must work together closely.
 Therefore, they cannot be combined in any random way.
 Which _Parser_ is supported by which _Listener_ is described in the documentation of each respective _Parser_.
 
+=== Connectors
+
+_Connectors_ initiate a connection and maintain a session with agent. A new connector is created for every agent it is responsible for connecting to.

nodes.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            Agent here refers to an IP-Service which is a named service attached to an IP interface on a specific node.
          
          
            
            Agent here refers to an IP service that is a named service attached to an IP interface on a specific node.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -28,6 +28,15 @@ _Parsers_ and _Listeners_ must work together closely.
 Therefore, they cannot be combined in any random way.
 Which _Parser_ is supported by which _Listener_ is described in the documentation of each respective _Parser_.
 
+=== Connectors
+
+_Connectors_ initiate a connection and maintain a session with agent. A new connector is created for every agent it is responsible for connecting to.
+Agent here refers to an IP-Service which is a named service attached to an IP interface on a specific node.

nodes.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            Connectors don't use parsers and dispatch messages directly to queue.
          
          
            
            Connectors don't use parsers, and dispatch messages directly to a queue.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -28,6 +28,15 @@ _Parsers_ and _Listeners_ must work together closely.
 Therefore, they cannot be combined in any random way.
 Which _Parser_ is supported by which _Listener_ is described in the documentation of each respective _Parser_.
 
+=== Connectors
+
+_Connectors_ initiate a connection and maintain a session with agent. A new connector is created for every agent it is responsible for connecting to.
+Agent here refers to an IP-Service which is a named service attached to an IP interface on a specific node.
+Connectors don't use parsers and dispatch messages directly to queue.

nodes.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            OpenConfig Connector initiates a connection via gRPC and subscribe to one or more OpenConfig data paths (strings) and then forwards the data to queue.
          
          
            
            OpenConfig Connector initiates a connection via gRPC and subscribes to one or more OpenConfig data paths (strings) and then forwards the data to a queue.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -51,7 +51,6 @@ ${OPENNMS_HOME}bin/send-event.pl -p 'daemonName Telemetryd' uei.opennms.org/inte
 
 OpenConfig Connector initiates a connection via gRPC and subscribe to one or more OpenConfig data paths (strings) and then forwards the data to queue.

nodes.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            Multiple packages can be used to customize the parameters subsets of nodes.
          
          
            
            Use multiple packages to customize the parameter's subsets of nodes.
          
      
    
    
  

Do the subsets of nodes belong to the parameter?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -75,9 +74,13 @@ OpenConfig Connector initiates a connection via gRPC and subscribe to one or mor
 
 ----
 
-
 ====== Packages
-Connector can have multiple packages. A package consists of filter and a list of parameters specific to interfaces that match the filter.
+At least one package must be present for the connector to function.
+Multiple packages can be used to customize the parameters subsets of nodes.

nodes.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            The `filter` element is optional, if missing, all services with the given name will be considered.
          
          
            
            The `filter` element is optional; if missing, all services with the given name will be considered.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -75,9 +74,13 @@ OpenConfig Connector initiates a connection via gRPC and subscribe to one or mor
 
 ----
 
-
 ====== Packages
-Connector can have multiple packages. A package consists of filter and a list of parameters specific to interfaces that match the filter.
+At least one package must be present for the connector to function.
+Multiple packages can be used to customize the parameters subsets of nodes.
+
+The `filter` element is optional, if missing, all services with the given name will be considered.

nodes.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            Parameters are passed to the connector and are interpolated for node/interface & service level meta-data.
          
          
            
            Parameters are passed to the connector and are interpolated for node/interface and service-level metadata.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -75,9 +74,13 @@ OpenConfig Connector initiates a connection via gRPC and subscribe to one or mor
 
 ----
 
-
 ====== Packages
-Connector can have multiple packages. A package consists of filter and a list of parameters specific to interfaces that match the filter.
+At least one package must be present for the connector to function.
+Multiple packages can be used to customize the parameters subsets of nodes.
+
+The `filter` element is optional, if missing, all services with the given name will be considered.
+
+Parameters are passed to the connector and are interpolated for node/interface & service level meta-data.
